os module function wrappers than can work with both nimscript and regular target.

Os wrapper with more typesafe operations for envrionment variables, paths etc. Provides many convenience utilities on top of oswrap. Tested to work on both nimscript and compiled backend. Proc names were taken from std/nimscript - cpFile instead of copyFile and so on.

Main focus of this module is to provide drop-in replacement for std/os and elmination of the unchecked raw strings when working with OS - executing shell code, working with environment variables and filesystem paths.

Even though std/os is OS-agnostic and designed to work on both UNIX-like operating systems and windows, this module provides some extensions that are not fully portable (yet), and might rely on std/posix module.

Wrappers XDG directory specification are provided in form of getUserConfigDir() and getAppConfigDir() - as well as all other directories specified in the standard.

Imports

hstring_algo

Types

ShellVar = distinct string
ShellExpr = distinct string
Shell expression Can be evaluated by external shell invokation (bash, zsh etc). Supported syntax on shell being used 
AbsFile = distinct string
AbsDir = distinct string
AbsPath = AbsFile | AbsDir
RelFile = distinct string
RelDir = distinct string
RelPath = RelFile | RelDir
FsFile = object
  case isRelative*: bool
  of true:
      relFile*: RelFile

  of false:
      absFile*: AbsFile

  
FsDir = object
  case isRelative*: bool
  of true:
      relDir*: RelDir

  of false:
      absDir*: AbsDir

  
FsEntry = object
  case kind*: os.PathComponent
  of os.pcFile, os.pcLinkToFile:
      file*: FsFile

  of os.pcDir, os.pcLinkToDir:
      dir*: FsDir

  
FsTree = object
  basename*: string
  parent*: seq[string]
  isAbsolute*: bool
  case isDir*: bool
  of true:
      sub*: seq[FsTree]

  of false:
      ext*: string

  
PathErrorKind = enum
  pekExpectedDir, pekExpectedFile, pekExpectedAbs, pekExpectedRel,
  pekNoSuchEntry, pekInvalidEntry
PathError = ref object of OSError
  entry*: FsEntry
  kind*: PathErrorKind

AnyPath = AbsFile | AbsDir | RelFile | RelDir | FsFile | FsDir | FsEntry |
    FsTree
AnyDir = AbsDir | RelDir | FsDir
AnyFile = AbsFile | RelFile | FsFile
CmdLineKind = enum
  cmdEnd, cmdArgument, cmdLongOption, cmdShortOption
OptParser = object of RootObj
  pos*: int
  inShortState: bool
  allowWhitespaceAfterColon: bool
  shortNoVal: set[char]
  longNoVal: seq[string]
  cmds: seq[string]
  idx: int
  kind*: CmdLineKind
  key*, val*: TaintedString

Consts

cbackend = true
CurDir = "."
ParDir = ".."
DirSep = '/'
AltSep = '/'
PathSep = ':'
ExeExts = [""]
DistributionGenericOsNames = {Distribution.Windows, Distribution.Posix,
                              Distribution.Linux}
DistributionDebianDerivatives = {Distribution.Ubuntu, Distribution.Elementary,
                                 Distribution.SteamOS, Distribution.KNOPPIX,
                                 Distribution.Debian}

proc normalizePathEnd(path: var AnyPath; trailingSep = false): void
Ensures path has exactly 0 or 1 trailing DirSep, depending on trailingSep, and taking care of edge cases: it preservers whether a path is absolute or relative, and makes sure trailing sep is DirSep, not AltSep. Trailing /. are compressed, see examples.

proc getUserRuntimeDir(): AbsDir {...}{.raises: [],
                                   tags: [ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect].}

Defines the base directory relative to which user-specific non-essential runtime files and other file objects (such as sockets, named pipes, ...) should be stored.

XDG specification does not provide default value for this variable. For systemd systems it is assumed to be equal to /run/user/<user-id>. Right now dummy implementation only accounts for systemd, but this should be fixed later.

proc getUserCacheDir(): AbsDir {...}{.raises: [], tags: [ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect].}
The base directory relative to which user specific non-essential data files should be stored.

proc toDll(filename: string): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
On Windows adds ".dll" to filename, on Posix produces "lib$filename.so".

proc mkDir(dir: AnyDir | string)
Creates the directory dir including all necessary subdirectories. If the directory already exists, no error is raised.

Moves the file from to to.

Moves the dir from to to.

Copies the file from to to.

Copies the dir from to to.

Iterators

iterator parentDirs(path: AnyPath; fromRoot: bool = false;
                    inclusive: bool = true): AbsDir
iterator walkDir(dir: AnyDir; relative: bool = false; yieldFilter = {pcFile}): FsEntry
iterator walkDirRec(dir: AnyDir; yieldFilter = {pcFile}; followFilter = {pcDir};
                    relative = false; checkDir = false): FsEntry
iterator walkDir[T: AnyPath](dir: AnyDir; resType: typedesc[T];
                             recurse: bool = true; yieldLinks: bool = true): T

Iterate over entries in dir, yielding only those that match resType.

For example, when resType is RelFile you will only get entries that represent file, and path will be relative. This is a higher-level wrapper that takes advantage of distinct types for files/directories and eliminates need to filter by entry kind in the calling loop.

Example:

for dir in walkDir(~".config", RelDir):
  assert dir is RelDir
iterator getopt(p: var OptParser): tuple[kind: CmdLineKind,
    key, val: TaintedString] {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
iterator getopt(cmdline: seq[TaintedString] = paramStrs();
                shortNoVal: set[char] = {}; longNoVal: seq[string] = @[]): tuple[
    kind: CmdLineKind, key, val: TaintedString] {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
